intro: Steffensia schlechtendalii, commonly known as the Schlechtendal's steffensia, is a rare and striking plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and clusters of vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves and stems. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered endangered and requires careful conservation efforts.
